page.title: 11The Shell House.
page.content: Mrs. T.Barnes(now Amott) covered the walls of her house with shells in {1977,}it took one year to complete. The shells were found by friends, neighbours and local fishermen, and were varnished after she put them in place. {There are 19 varieties of {shells }including mussells, cockles, scallops & razor shells. On the walls are pictures of figures, amimals & birds; {they are all people who Mrs. {Amott has known and creatures she has {seen.}There is a peacock, a seagull, a shepherd with sheep, a squirrel, a girl riding a horse with a foal & Mrs. Amott's alsatian. In her garden she has made a castle, a windmill and a wishing well with shells. {She found a {cannon ball in her garden which she {thinks may have come from Camber {Castle.}The Shell House can be found at Morlais Ridge,Winchelsea Beach.
